items.title: Nvidia builds location verification tech that could help fight chip smuggling
items.creator: Reuters
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Nvidia builds location verification tech that could help fight chip smuggling

images.alt: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang speaks at the Nvidia GTC (GPU Technology Conference) in Washington, DC, on October 28, 2025. Photo: AFP
images.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang speaks at the Nvidia GTC (GPU Technology Conference) in Washington, DC, on October 28, 2025. Photo: AFP

items.content:
Nvidia has built location verification technology that could indicate which country its chips are operating in, the company confirmed on Wednesday, a move that could help prevent its artificial intelligence chips from being smuggled into countries where their export is banned.
The feature, which Nvidia has demonstrated privately in recent months but has not yet released, would be a software option that customers could install. It would tap into what are known as the confidential computing...

items.title: Less hype and more hardware: SenseTime banks on multimodal AI to regain its edge
items.creator: Vincent Chow
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Less hype and more hardware: SenseTime banks on multimodal AI to regain its edge
items.content:
Chinese artificial intelligence pioneer SenseTime is betting that its roots in computer vision will help it lead the next phase of AI, as the industry shifts towards multimodal systems and embodied intelligence in the physical world, according to co-founder and chief scientist Lin Dahua.
In an interview with the Post on Wednesday, Lin said the company’s long-standing expertise in vision-based AI put it in a strong position to become a leader in embodied intelligence, robotics and AI agents...

A new direction for cloud computing
At re:Invent 2025 in Las Vegas, Amazon Web Services (AWS) outlined a bold new chapter in its evolution. Matt Garman, CEO of AWS and Dr. Swami Sivasubramanian, Vice President of Agentic AI at AWS, described how the company is reshaping its platform to enable a world of autonomous, reasoning systems. The event focused on AI agents able to analyse data, take action, and collaborate with...

items.title: Chinese supercomputer maker Sugon and chip developer Hygon call off merger plans
items.creator: Ann Cao

items.translated_title: Chinese supercomputer maker Sugon and chip developer Hygon call off merger plans

images.alt: The headquarters of Sugon is at the Zhongguancun Software Park in Beijing. Photo: Handout
images.title: The headquarters of Sugon is at the Zhongguancun Software Park in Beijing. Photo: Handout

items.content:
Chinese supercomputer maker Sugon and chip designer Hygon Information Technology have called off a planned mega-merger that had been under discussion for months, in a surprise move that could complicate the country’s tech self-sufficiency efforts in the semiconductor and high-performance computing sectors.
The two Shanghai-listed companies late on Tuesday said they cancelled merger talks because “the market environment has changed significantly since the initial planning stages of this...

items.title: Alibaba names AI-lab leader Zhou Jingren as new group partner
items.creator: Wency Chen
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Alibaba names AI-lab leader Zhou Jingren as new group partner
items.content:
Alibaba Group Holding named its cloud unit’s technology officer Zhou Jingren, who also leads its artificial intelligence lab Tongyi and the development of its Qwen AI models, as a new member of the group in charge of steering the business empire, according to people briefed about the decision.
Alibaba has not updated the information on its official website. The Alibaba Partnership had 17 members before the addition, including co-founders Jack Ma and Joe Tsai as permanent ones.
Alibaba did not...

items.title: AI race comes down to power and data centres – and China has the edge, says unicorn hunter
items.creator: Ben Jiang
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: AI race comes down to power and data centres – and China has the edge, says unicorn hunter
items.content:
China is likely to overtake the United States in artificial intelligence within a decade because of its faster buildout of the power and data-centre infrastructure that AI relies on, according to a veteran Chinese investor.
“It’s much easier [for China] to catch up on algorithms and AI models than [for the US] to build up the data centres and power plants [that run AI],” said Allen Zhu Xiaohu, managing director at GSR Ventures, on a recent podcast.
“AI competition is really a competition in data...

items.translated_title: China’s Moore Threads to unveil AI chip road map to rival Nvidia’s CUDA system

images.alt: Moore Threads Technology founder, chairman and CEO Zhang Jianzhong speaks at the launch of the firm’s KUAE system, a GPU-based computing platform for AI training, in Beijing on December 19, 2023. Photo: Moore Threads
images.title: Moore Threads Technology founder, chairman and CEO Zhang Jianzhong speaks at the launch of the firm’s KUAE system, a GPU-based computing platform for AI training, in Beijing on December 19, 2023. Photo: Moore Threads

items.content:
Moore Threads Technology is set to launch its latest graphics processing unit (GPU) architecture next week, fresh from the Chinese artificial intelligence chip designer’s stellar trading debut last Friday in Shanghai.
Founder, chairman and CEO Zhang Jianzhong will unveil the Beijing-based firm’s fifth-generation GPU architecture during its inaugural MUSA Developer Conference on December 19 and 20 in the nation’s capital, according to the company’s latest post on WeChat.
MUSA refers to the firm’s...

items.title: China’s Fosun Pharma unit strikes US$2.1 billion obesity drug deal with Pfizer

items.translated_title: China’s Fosun Pharma unit strikes US$2.1 billion obesity drug deal with Pfizer

images.alt: Pfizer has agreed to pay up to US$2.1 billion to Fosun Pharma’s unit Yao Pharma for an experimental oral obesity drug. Photo: Reuters
images.title: Pfizer has agreed to pay up to US$2.1 billion to Fosun Pharma’s unit Yao Pharma for an experimental oral obesity drug. Photo: Reuters

items.content:
US pharmaceutical behemoth Pfizer has agreed to pay up to US$2.1 billion to Shanghai-based Fosun Pharma’s unit Yao Pharma for an experimental oral obesity drug, underscoring the growing trend of Chinese drug makers selling early-stage assets to global multinationals.
Under the licensing agreement, Yao Pharma would grant Pfizer an exclusive worldwide licence for the development, use, manufacturing and commercialisation of oral small-molecule drugs known as GLP-1 receptor agonists, including...

items.title: Microsoft makes US$17.5 billion pledge for AI cloud in India
items.creator: Bloomberg
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Microsoft makes US$17.5 billion pledge for AI cloud in India

images.alt: The Microsoft logo at its offices in Issy-les-Moulineaux near Paris, France, March 25, 2024. Photo: Reuters
images.title: The Microsoft logo at its offices in Issy-les-Moulineaux near Paris, France, March 25, 2024. Photo: Reuters

items.content:
Microsoft pledged to invest US$17.5 billion on artificial intelligence and cloud computing in India over four years, targeting the world’s most populous nation to help fuel its growth.
Chief Executive Officer Satya Nadella made the announcement Tuesday after meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi, ahead of a tour through the country. Microsoft said the investment will focus on three pillars – scale, skills and sovereignty – which align with Modi’s goal of building a broad...

items.title: OpenAI names first chief of revenue as ChatGPT maker aims to make a profit (原标题: OpenAI names Slack CEO as first chief of revenue as ChatGPT maker aims to make a profit)
items.creator: Associated Press
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: OpenAI names first chief of revenue as ChatGPT maker aims to make a profit

images.alt: The ChatGPT logo is seen in this illustration taken January 22, 2025. Photo: Reuters
images.title: The ChatGPT logo is seen in this illustration taken January 22, 2025. Photo: Reuters

items.content:
OpenAI said Tuesday it has picked Slack CEO Denise Dresser as its first chief of revenue, a message to wary investors that the ChatGPT maker is serious about making a profit from its artificial intelligence technology.
OpenAI said Dresser will oversee global revenue strategy and “help more businesses put AI to work in their day-to-day operations”.
Dresser had already spent more than a decade at Salesforce when the software pioneer announced in 2020 it was buying work-chatting service Slack for...

items.title: Alibaba creates new unit to push consumer use of its Qwen AI models
items.creator: Wency Chen
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Alibaba creates new unit to push consumer use of its Qwen AI models
items.content:
Alibaba Group Holding said on Tuesday that it will set up a new division to push the consumer use of artificial intelligence applications based on its Qwen family of large language models.
The new business unit, Qwen Consumer Business Group, led by Alibaba vice-president Wu Jia, will oversee the Qwen chatbot app, the Quark AI assistant and cloud drive, AI hardware products, the UC Browser and the online reading platform Shuqi.
The move marked a significant organisational change at Alibaba to...

Aligning with the latest direction of I&T development outlined in the Chief Executive’s Policy Address – which calls for accelerating AI advancement alongside the development of the Northern Metropolis and the Hetao Shenzhen-Hong Kong Science and Technology Innovation Co-operation Zone (the Loop) – ASTRI has intensified its push for AI+ applications. This initiative integrates AI with patented technologies across fields...

items.title: Investors brace as Beijing’s policy huddle tests China’s stock rebound (原标题: Investors brace as Beijing’s policy huddle tests durability of China stock rebound)
items.creator: Zhang Shidong
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Investors brace as Beijing’s policy huddle tests China’s stock rebound
items.content:
Investors are gearing up for a key economic policy meeting to be attended by President Xi Jinping and other top leaders, looking for signals on whether the high-stakes gathering will inject fresh momentum into a stock rally that has already run hard this year.
The annual Central Economic Work Conference – a year-end fixture that sets the tone for the following year’s macroeconomic agenda – is taking centre stage, with the market in need of new catalysts to extend a solid run this year.
Investors...

items.title: China’s Deep Robotics raises US$70 million as sector draws more investors (原标题: China’s Deep Robotics raises US$70 million in fresh funds as sector draws more investors)
items.creator: Danielle Popov
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China’s Deep Robotics raises US$70 million as sector draws more investors
items.content:
Deep Robotics – one of the “Six Little Dragons” from Hangzhou, the capital of eastern Zhejiang province – on Tuesday said it had raised 500 million yuan (US$70 million) in fresh funding from a group of Chinese investors.
According to the company’s statement, its latest round of financing was led by CMB International, China Asset Management and funds under state-owned telecommunications network operators China Telecom and China Unicom.
Deep Robotics founder and CEO Zhu Qiuguo, who also serves as...

items.title: China’s AI developers to welcome Nvidia’s H200 chip shipments, analysts say (原标题: Tech war: China’s AI developers to welcome Nvidia’s H200 chip shipments, analysts say)
items.creator: Ann Cao
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China’s AI developers to welcome Nvidia’s H200 chip shipments, analysts say
items.content:
China’s artificial intelligence developers are expected to welcome Washington’s go-ahead for Nvidia to ship its H200 AI chips to approved customers on the mainland, according to analysts, even as Beijing continues to drive the country’s tech self-sufficiency efforts.
In a post on his Truth Social platform on Monday, US President Donald Trump said he had informed his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, of that decision “under conditions that allow for continued strong national security”. Xi had...

items.title: Tencent quits Paramount’s Warner Bros bid amid US regulatory concerns
items.creator: Iris Deng
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Tencent quits Paramount’s Warner Bros bid amid US regulatory concerns
items.content:
Chinese social media and gaming giant Tencent Holdings has pulled out of US media group Paramount Skydance Corp’s takeover bid for Warner Bros Discovery to avoid heightened scrutiny of foreign investment in the United States, according to a filing on the US Securities and Exchange Commission’s website.
Tencent had pledged US$1 billion as part of Paramount’s December 1 proposal to acquire Warner Bros, but the Shenzhen-based company was removed as a financing partner in Paramount’s latest all-cash...

items.title: DeepSeek’s Liang Wenfeng among top 10 ‘people who shaped science in 2025’ (原标题: DeepSeek’s Liang Wenfeng makes the cut in top 10 ‘people who shaped science in 2025’)

items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: DeepSeek’s Liang Wenfeng among top 10 ‘people who shaped science in 2025’
items.content:
DeepSeek’s founder and CEO, Liang Wenfeng, has been listed among the top 10 “people who shaped science in 2025” by the British journal Nature, which hailed the 40-year-old entrepreneur as a “Chinese finance whizz” whose breakthrough artificial intelligence models had stunned the world.
The Nature’s 10 profile of Liang recognised the disruption caused in January by the release of DeepSeek-R1, a reasoning model that showed how “the United States was not as far ahead in AI as many experts had...

items.title: Z.ai open sources AI agent tool for phones after ByteDance privacy backlash (原标题: China’s Z.ai open sources AI agent tool for phones after ByteDance privacy backlash)
items.creator: Ben Jiang

items.translated_title: Z.ai open sources AI agent tool for phones after ByteDance privacy backlash

images.alt: Z.ai’s decision to open source AutoGLM comes at a time when ByteDance has stirred industry-wide controversy with its recently released Doubao AI phone. Photo: Handout
images.title: Z.ai’s decision to open source AutoGLM comes at a time when ByteDance has stirred industry-wide controversy with its recently released Doubao AI phone. Photo: Handout

items.content:
Chinese artificial intelligence start-up Z.ai on Tuesday open sourced a tool it spent years developing to put AI capability into every smartphone, a move that follows backlash against ByteDance’s newly released AI phone over privacy concerns.
Beijing-based Z.ai, also known as Zhipu AI, said it released its Phone Agent – the software framework underpinning AutoGLM, an AI agent app it launched last year to perform tasks on smartphones for users – on the source code platforms GitHub and Hugging...

items.title: How China can help Africa build human capital
items.creator: Winston Mok
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: How China can help Africa build human capital
items.content:
Whereas then US president Joe Biden initially missed the group photo at the annual Group of 20 summit in Rio de Janeiro last year, requiring a reshoot, his successor did not even bother showing up for this year’s meeting in Johannesburg. US President Donald Trump boycotted the summit due to alleged mistreatment of white people in post-apartheid South Africa.
Yet, even in the absence of the US, the G20 managed to make a leaders’ declaration at the start of the summit, which usually comes at the...

items.title: HashKey aims for US$214 million in Hong Kong IPO amid Beijing’s crypto pressure
items.creator: Themis Qi
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: HashKey aims for US$214 million in Hong Kong IPO amid Beijing’s crypto pressure

images.alt: HashKey operates one of 11 virtual asset trading platforms recognised by Hong Kong’s Securities and Futures Commission. Photo: Handout
images.title: HashKey operates one of 11 virtual asset trading platforms recognised by Hong Kong’s Securities and Futures Commission. Photo: Handout

items.content:
Crypto exchange operator HashKey Holdings has launched its share sale in Hong Kong, testing investor appetite amid repeated warnings against virtual currencies by China’s central bank.
Hong Kong’s largest licensed crypto player set its initial public offering (IPO) price range at HK$5.95 to HK$6.95 apiece for more than 240 million shares, according to a filing on Tuesday. The listing date is December 17.
With the price range, HashKey is eyeing up to HK$1.67 billion (US$214 million). In October,...
